channel.title: Problems
channel.description:
Ok, sorry to sound like a noob, but I need help.
I have my no-ip adress (slomiscape.no-ip.info) I have a moparscape client (v. 3.2) I have a source code (PimpScape)
Now what? I followed instructions on another post, and it still didne't work. It said to use 127.0.0.1 as my i.p, that dosent work. I have my runserver and compiler minimized. Anyone who has a working pimpscape based server, help would be appreciated!
Edit: I just remembered, I'm behind a router, and I can't find it's manual, so I don't know how to get it to allow the port, could this be the problem?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 02:02:22 PM[/size][hr]bump

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

Everybody, try to log on!

slomiscape.no-ip.info
5555

thx

(If you get on, add admin,chessgirl,killer admin and pm which evers on. Thx)[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 06:05:24 PM[/size][hr]plz![br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 06:42:47 PM[/size][hr]anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @Staccia Staccia
item.description:
@Staccia wrote:

losers dont know anything… just use hamachi till you can get it sorted out, im going throu the same shit

Read full topic

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

When I try to get onto it, it takes me to hybridscape. I think the problem is just that I need to forward the port. My router’s manual dosen’t say how to forward ports, any suggestions?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 04:17:15 PM[/size][hr]Omg! it’s 5555, not the default! Dam! Thx, i’ll try that now.[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 04:19:41 PM[/size][hr]ok, now it says invalid username/password, which isen’t true. I checked, they are both correct. Whats wrong now?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 04:22:13 PM[/size][hr]im on! someone come onto slomiscape.no-ip.info 5555 to test to see if it’s working.

Read full topic

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @adam2348 adam2348
item.description:
@adam2348 wrote:

can u access ur own server, using localhost or 127.0.0.1? if u can, then router is blocking other ppl from accessing it. if not then maybe the source is on another port, check server.java for the port.
should look like this:

public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594; //43594=default

try looking for manual for ur router online

Read full topic

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @Blake11roys Blake11roys
item.description:
@Blake11roys wrote:

your problem is u didnt port forward it

Read full topic

Ok, sorry to sound like a noob, but I need help.

I have my no-ip adress (slomiscape.no-ip.info)

I have a source code (PimpScape)
